page.title: 14A Day in the Life of .......
page.content: .......Matthew Jackson (age 11). "Up at about 7.00 a.m., I washed ready for breakfast. The school taxi arrived, driven by Mr. Towers. At school, Mr. Hall showed us a problem page that took most of the morning. English, Maths and Spelling. A big spelling test came before lunch. I was glad to hear the lunch bell. When I got home I was put in charge of the tea. It did not go too well. I put the cooker on without any meat, so we settled for fish fingers and chips. That night, after a lot of rehearsals, it was the real thing -The Scouts 1985 Gang Show. Makeup was put on our faces and in no time it was all finished. After all that,I was glad to get my head down for the night. All I could think of was school next day."
